Uses of Interface
javax0.wtf.Step

  • Packages that use Step 
    Package Description
    javax0.wtf
    This package contains the interfaces that define workflow.
    javax0.wtf.simple
    This package contains the simple workflow implementation.

    • Uses of Step in javax0.wtf

      Methods in javax0.wtf that return Step 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Step Action.getStep()
      Get the step that this action is executed from.
      Step[] Result.getSteps()  
      Step[] Workflow.getSteps()
      Get the steps that the work flow is currently in.
      default Step[] Action.perform()
      Execute the pre-function, validator and post-function for the specific action and moves the workflow to the target step or target steps in case the action with the result returned by the post function is a split action.
      Step[] Action.performPost(java.lang.Object transientObject, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> userInput)
      Execute the post-function of the action.
      Methods in javax0.wtf with parameters of type Step 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Action.join(Step[] steps)
      Join the steps listed in the argument list into this action.
